review_title: Totally rewarding yet mentally tiring job
pros:
knowing you're making a difference to these families
Excellent acquisition of skills & knowledge
Regular training & updates
Encouragement of special interests
cons:
The usual staffing issues
Mental effects of working with life limited families
Not a huge amount of scope for progression

pros: Worthwhile cause, beautiful location, great people, development of staff, family feel, pride and commitment amongst staff and volunteers.
cons: Charity, so not very big salaries compared to corporate sector. Lots of hard work!
